revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Compaq |model=WL400 |revision= |asin=B009SHPKJM |fcc_date=11/05/1999 |manuf_country=Netherlands |is_manuf=No |manuf=No Wires Needed |manuf_model=Parrot 1100 |manuf_rev= |availability=uncommon |type=access point |fcc_id=OGD10310308 |ic_id=780 102 1699A |pwr_v=9 |pwr_amp=1.67 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=5 |pwr_barrel_inner=2.2 |pwr_barrel_len=9.5 |cpu1_brand=VLSI |cpu1_model=VPS10101-1 |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=0.5 |fla1_brand=AMD |fla1_model=AM29F040B-120PC |ram1=2 |ram1_brand=Alliance |ram1_model=AS7C4096-15JC |ram1_num=4 |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=VLSI |wi1_chip1_model=VPS10101-1 |wi1_chip2_brand=Harris |wi1_chip2_model=HFA3860 |wi1_chip3_brand=Harris |wi1_chip3_model=HFA3624 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=b |wi1_ant_conn=SMA |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand=AMD |eth_chip1_model=AM79C961A |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=10M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags=parts list |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid=COMPAQ |default_ssid_regex=^COMPAQ$ |default_ip=169.254.27.164 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:50:8B |oui_eth=00:50:8B }} "Parrot 11Mbps" and "MAC V3.2" is silkscreened on the board. :This access point is a '''No Wires Needed''' Parrot 1100, like the [[BreezeCOM AP-DS.11]].
This device is using a '''VLSI''' VPS10101-1 ('''Ruby II''' General-Purpose PCMCIA controller w/ 32-bit ARM6 core, [http://www.thefreelibrary.com/VLSI+introduces+Ruby+II+PCMCIA+controller.-a016410275 press release on the chip from 1995]) and an '''AMD''' Am79C961AKC ISA Ethernet controller. :The VLSI CPU is presumably handling the MAC + AP functions of this board.
Per the FCC parts list.. *the '''VLSI''' VPS10101-1 is marked as the CPU *an [http://www.xilinx.com/support/documentation/data_sheets/ds060.pdf '''Xilinx''' Spartan XCS10] (XCS10-3VQ100C) FPGA, not visible on the below board scan - presumably under the RF shield *an additional 128k x 8 SRAM ('''UMC''' UM611024BSW-15), which is not visible on the below board scan. *the RFIC collection is a motley collection '''Harris''''s '''PRISM''' (the original) ICs **'''HFA3860''' (IV) - BBP (BaseBand Processor) **'''HFA3724''' (IN) - QAM (Modulator/Demodulator) **'''HFA3624''' (IA) - RFIC (Prescalar + IF/RF) **'''HFA3524''' (IA) - DS (Digital Synthesizer) **'''HFA3424''' (IB) - LNA (Low Noise Amp) **'''HFA3925''' (IA96) - PA (Power Amp)
The power adapter included with the device is a '''Sunpower''' MA15-090 (9V, 1.67A). ID/OD/Len measurements are approximate.
{{WiFiCert|W000592|04/10/2000}}
==Capab/Config== *The device supports 40-bit WEP encryption. *There is no HTTP interface on these devices. *Configuration is meant to be done through SNMP using '''NWN''''s configuration software.
==Models== *158603-001, North America *158603-B31, Europe *158603-011, Australia *158603-031, United Kingdom *158603-061, Italy *158603-081, Denmark *158603-111, Switzerland *158603-AR1, South Africa
==Images== <gallery caption="terrible board scans"> File:Compaq WL400 board top.jpg|board top File:Compaq WL400 board bot.jpg|board bottom </gallery>[[Has images::internal| ]]
==External links== *[https://www.motherboardpoint.com/threads/compaq-wl400-and-nwn-parrot-1100-aps-was-search-for-driver-nowiresneeded-accesspoint.50330/ A USENET post with some details] *[http://www.tomshardware.com/forum/10770-43-search-driver-nowiresneeded-accesspoint More info]
